item.title: 交易者指南：耶伦访华，中国股市成焦点
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）为应对中国廉价出口产品的威胁所做的努力，必将增加中国太阳能电池板、电动汽车和电池制造商的压力。【原文：US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen’s mission to address the threat of cheap China exports is set to increase pressure on the nation’s makers of solar panels, electric cars and batteries.】

item.title: 韩国大选反对党获胜，企业改革岌岌可危
item.description: 韩国人下周将前往投票站选举新一届议会，选举结果可能会威胁到政府类似日本的企业改革，而这些改革曾帮助刺激股市反弹。【原文：South Koreans head to the polls next week to elect a new parliament and the outcome may threaten the government’s Japan-like corporate reforms that have helped spur a stock market rally.】

item.title: 汇丰银行高层认为港股发行复苏乏力
item.description: 汇丰控股有限公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）的顶级投资银行家表示，即使流向中国的投资出现反弹迹象，香港低迷的首次公开募股（IPO）市场至少要到今年下半年才可能复苏。【原文：Hong Kong’s sluggish IPO market isn’t likely to recover until at least the second half of this year, even as investment flows to China show signs of rebounding, according to HSBC Holdings Plc’s top investment banker.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。交易商们正在为美国就业报告做准备。布伦特原油触及每桶 90 美元。美元回升令全球央行恼火。以下是市场动向。【原文：Good morning. Traders are gearing up for the US jobs report. Brent crude hits $90 a barrel. A resurgent US dollar exasperates global central banks. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 中东紧张局势推动布伦特原油进一步上涨至 90 美元以上
item.description: 随着中东紧张局势的进一步升级，石油价格上涨。【原文：Oil headed for a weekly gain as tensions in the Middle East escalated further.】

item.title: 日本的日元干预策略面临美国数据的巨大考验
item.description: 日本货币再次受到美国经济的摆布，东京为陷入困境的日元争取时间的努力很容易受到美联储降息前景变化的影响。【原文：Japan’s currency is yet again at the mercy of the US economy, with Tokyo’s efforts to buy time for the beleaguered yen vulnerable to shifts in the outlook for interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 就业数据公布前股市承压，石油上涨：市场综述
item.description: 由于利率不确定性和地缘政治紧张局势影响了市场情绪，在美国股市下跌之后，亚洲股市周五早盘开始下跌。【原文：Shares in Asia were headed for early declines Friday after US stocks fell, as interest rate uncertainty and geopolitical tensions weighed on sentiment.】

item.title: 彭比纳公司继续推进西达液化天然气项目，成本增至 34 亿美元
item.description: 彭宾纳管道公司（Pembina Pipeline Corp.）表示，西达液化天然气项目的成本已上升至 34 亿美元，该公司正努力争取在今年年中做出最终投资决定。【原文：Pembina Pipeline Corp. said costs on the Cedar LNG project have escalated to $3.4 billion as the company works toward a final investment decision by the middle of this year.】

item.title: 战神牵头为 CentralSquare 完成 12 亿美元再融资交易
item.description: 据知情人士透露，以 Ares Management Corp. 为首的私人信贷公司将向软件开发商 CentralSquare Technologies 提供超过 12 亿美元的一揽子债务，以对其债务进行再融资。【原文：Private credit firms led by Ares Management Corp. are providing a more than $1.2 billion debt package to software developer CentralSquare Technologies to refinance its debt, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 美联储中央银行工具的使用日益增多，现金囤积仍在继续
item.description: 外国央行对美联储一项关键机制的使用率连续第三周上升，这表明世界各地的政策制定者在警告他们将采取措施支撑本国货币的同时，仍在不断增加现金头寸。【原文：Foreign central bank usage of a key Federal Reserve facility rose for a third week, an indication policymakers around the world keep building cash positions amid warnings they will take steps to bolster their currencies.】

item.title: 私营监狱运营商 GEO 出售 12.8 亿美元债券
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，私营监狱运营商 GEO 集团出售了约 12.8 亿美元的债券，用于债务再融资，交易规模超过了最初的报价。【原文：Private prison operator GEO Group sold about $1.28 billion of bonds to refinance debt, increasing the scale of the deal over what was initially offered, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 贝莱德面临激进分子关于拆分首席执行官和董事长角色的提议
item.description: 蓝铃资本合伙公司（Bluebell Capital Partners）对贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc.【原文：Bluebell Capital Partners is escalating its activist campaign against BlackRock Inc. with a shareholder proposal to bar Larry Fink from serving as both chief executive officer and chairman.】

item.title: 99 Cents Only Stores 宣布结束运营计划
item.description: 折扣零售商 99 Cents Only Stores LLC 周四发布新闻稿，宣布计划结束业务运营。【原文：Discount retailer 99 Cents Only Stores LLC announced plans to wind down its business operations in a press release on Thursday.】

item.title: 全球紧张局势提振避险天堂，日元创近一个月最大涨幅
item.description: 由于中东紧张局势加剧刺激了高风险资产的抛售，日元创下近一个月来的最大涨幅，从交易商猜测将引发日本干预的水平回落。【原文：The yen rallied the most in nearly a month, pulling back from levels that traders speculated would spark Japanese intervention, as rising tensions in the Middle East spurred a selloff in riskier assets.】

item.title: 雷-达里奥将桥水的交接比作培养成功的孩子
item.description: Bridgewater Associates 创始人雷-达里奥（Ray Dalio）表示，在他将领导权移交给年轻一代之后，对冲基金的业绩将是他成功的最终标志。【原文：Bridgewater Associates founder Ray Dalio said the hedge fund’s performance after his leadership transition to a younger generation will be the ultimate marker of his success.】

item.title: 美联储按兵不动，货币市场现金创历史新高
item.description: 货币市场基金资产升至历史新高，因为最新的美联储言论表明，官员们并不急于开始削减利率，因此预期短期利率将继续保持高位。【原文：Money-market fund assets rose to an all-time high on expectations short-term rates will remain elevated as the latest Fedspeak suggests officials are in no rush to start cutting.】

item.title: 石油反弹突破关键期权价位为更多涨幅奠定基础
item.description: 由于地缘政治紧张局势升级，原油在尾盘飙升至每桶 91 美元以上，价值 3,000 多万桶的看涨期权目前处于盈利状态，这可能会进一步推动原油的上涨。【原文：Crude oil’s late-session surge to more than $91 a barrel on escalating geopolitical tensions may get an additional boost from more than 30 million barrels worth of bullish options that are now in the money.】

item.title: Thoma Bravo 下一个收购基金的目标是 200 亿美元
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Thoma Bravo 的目标是为其下一个旗舰收购基金筹集约 200 亿美元。【原文：Thoma Bravo is targeting to raise about $20 billion for its next flagship buyout fund, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚瞄准因巨额收费而声名狼藉的 90 亿美元基金市场
item.description: 哥伦比亚正在努力促进因天价收费而臭名昭著的 90 亿美元金融市场的竞争。【原文：Colombia is seeking to boost competition in a $9 billion financial market notorious for astronomical fees.】

item.title: 奥特曼支持的以核能公司为目标的 SPAC 已大涨 22
item.description: 萨姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）和迈克尔-克莱因（Michael Klein）支持的空白支票公司将一家先进核系统开发商上市，投资者纷纷涌入这家公司，使其成为市场上表现最好的 SPAC。【原文：Investors have piled into the blank-check firm backed by Sam Altman and Michael Klein that’s taking a developer of advanced nuclear systems public, making it the top performing SPAC on the market.】

item.title: 总承包商 Tutor Perini 聘请高盛进行债务再融资
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Tutor Perini 公司聘请高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Tutor Perini Corp. hired Goldman Sachs Group Inc. to help it address upcoming maturities and refinance its debt, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 加拿大帝国商业银行首席执行官多迪格称今年不太可能多次降息
item.description: 加拿大帝国商业银行（Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce）首席执行官维克多-多迪格（Victor Dodig）预计，降息不会很快出现。【原文：Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce Chief Executive Officer Victor Dodig doesn’t expect a flurry of interest-rate cuts any time soon.】

item.title: 顶级小额贷款银行经济学家建议终止地方债券减税政策
item.description: 今年 3 月，一家保守派智库提出废除州政府和地方政府用于吸引债务投资的税收减免政策，此举将对 4 万亿美元的市政债券市场造成严重破坏。【原文：In March, a conservative think tank floated repealing the tax break that state and local governments use to induce investment in their debt, a move that would wreak havoc on the $4 trillion municipal-bond market.】

item.title: 布伦特原油期货自 10 月以来首次触及每桶 90 美元
item.description: 布伦特原油自 10 月份以来首次攀升至每桶 90 美元以上，延续了受欧佩克+减产、需求强劲和地缘政治风险加剧推动的涨势。【原文：Brent crude climbed above $90 a barrel for the first time since October, extending a rally driven by OPEC+ production cuts, strong demand and heightened geopolitical risks.】

item.title: 加密货币交易量在三月反弹期间创历史新高
item.description: 据 CCData 数据显示，3 月份集中式交易所的加密货币现货和衍生品交易量总和几乎翻了一番，达到 9.1 万亿美元的历史新高，而比特币的交易量也创下了历史新高。【原文：The combined volume of crypto spot and derivatives trading on centralized exchanges almost doubled to an all-time high of $9.1 trillion in March while Bitcoin reached a record, according to a CCData.】

item.title: 匈牙利甘孜公司斥资 6.19 亿欧元收购西班牙塔尔戈公司
item.description: Ganz-Mavag Europe Zrt.正正式寻求西班牙政府批准其对 Talgo SA 6.193 亿欧元（约合 6.73 亿美元）的收购要约，该收购要约的推进引起了马德里方面对匈牙利收购方与总理维克托-欧尔班（Viktor Orban）关系的担忧。【原文：Ganz-Mavag Europe Zrt. is officially seeking approval from the Spanish government for its €619.3 million ($673 million) offer for Talgo SA, pressing ahead with a deal that’s raised concerns in Madrid over the Hungarian bidder’s links to Prime Minister Viktor Orban.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）总裁格奥尔基耶娃有望连任，提名即将结束
item.description: 克里斯塔琳娜-格奥尔基耶娃（Kristalina Georgieva）有望赢得国际货币基金组织的第二个五年任期，因为提名期已于周三结束，没有其他候选人向她发起挑战。【原文：Kristalina Georgieva is poised to win a second five-year term running the International Monetary Fund as the nomination period closed on Wednesday with no other candidates put forward to challenge her.】

item.title: 加州在出售 15 亿美元债券前风险溢价攀升
item.description: 就在这个美国人口最多的州准备借贷 15 亿美元，同时又面临巨额预算赤字之际，加州债券的收益率溢价飙升。【原文：The yield premium on California bonds has jumped just as the most populous US state readies to borrow $1.5 billion while staring down a massive budget deficit.】

item.title: 墨西哥央行对未来降息保持谨慎态度
item.description: 墨西哥央行成员自 2021 年以来首次降息时，对国内经济和通胀的韧性表示担忧，并表示未来的降息将是渐进的。【原文：Mexico central bank members raised concerns about a resilient domestic economy and inflation when they delivered their first interest rate cut since 2021, signaling any future reductions would be gradual.】

item.title: 尽管新兴市场反弹，但拉美主权债务问题依然存在
item.description: 拉丁美洲陷入困境的国家在债务问题上徘徊不前；这些国家虽然避免了违约，但却受到政治困境的拖累，其债券一直处于不良状态。【原文：Latin America’s troubled countries are lingering in debt limbo — avoiding default but weighed down by political woes that keep their bonds in distressed territory.】
